Driven by the band's principle duo of Gunni Ãƒâ€“rn Tynes and Ãƒâ€“rvar ÃƒÅ¾ÃƒÂ³reyjarson SmÃƒÂ¡rason, Ã¢â‚¬ËœSmilewoundÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ sees mÃƒÂºm take glitch-pop to galactic levels. Indeed if space was an environment the Nordic pair sought to capture, they've succeeded with ample supplies of starkness and sparseness.

Enriched by its ability to wander untethered by gravity or expectation, 'Smilewound' is ultimately an uplifting record, even if the lyrical content can, at times, be somewhat grave. From opening track, and lead single, 'Toothwheels' to closer 'Time To Scream And Shout', the album envelops the listener; placing them in a paradoxical realm where all is free flowing and empty yet safe and welcoming.
